alert.note: Alert for Oglala Lakota (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 11:01PM MDT until further notice by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...Southeastern Oglala Lakota County in southwestern South Dakota. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 PM MDT, Emergency management, Doppler radar, and automated gauges reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pine Ridge, Porcupine, Kyle, Manderson, Wounded Knee, Batesland, Porcupine Butte Housing, Evergreen, Sharps Corner, Goose Neck Housing, Thunder Valley, Wolf Creek Housing, Lonesome Valley, Calico, Kyle North Route Housing, Wakpamni, Number 4 and Pine Ridge Reservation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
